oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Differenzialdiagnose: Eine Methode zur Ursacheneingrenzung bei Bodenmüdigkeit
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Fuchs, Jacques G.
Bruns, Christian
Mäder, Paul
Schmidt, Harald
Thürig, Barbara
Wilbois, Klaus-Peter
Tamm, Lucius
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil quality
Crop combinations and interactions
Crop husbandry
Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fertile soils are highly important for arable farming. To maintain soil fertility, crop rotation including legumes is applied, particularly in stockless farms. Yet, many commercial farms report yield reductions for legumes. The aim of the present study was to evaluate whether the causes for the observed soil fatigue can be narrowed down by a bioassay (modified differential diagnosis according to Bouhot) and whether this bioassay could be a useful tool to predict the suitability of a field to grow legumes.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Fuchs, Jacques G.; Bruns, Christian; Mäder, Paul; Schmidt, Harald; Thürig, Barbara; Wilbois, Klaus-Peter and Tamm, Lucius (2013) Differenzialdiagnose: Eine Methode zur Ursacheneingrenzung bei Bodenmüdigkeit. Paper at: 12. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität, Bonn, 5. bis 8. März 2013.
